Manx: Resooney rhym pene (i).
Diplomatic: Resooney rum pene (i).

Manx: Ayns seihll dy voirey ta mee shooyl
English: In a world of trouble I walk,
Diplomatic: Ayns seihll dy voirey ta mee shooyl

Manx: Ny-yeih bee’m rey rish er y çhooyl
English: Yet I will be rid of it by and by,
Diplomatic: Ny-yeih beem rey rish er y choyl

Manx: Ta’n ghrian goll siyragh gys yn sheear
English: The sun goes in a hurry to the West,
Diplomatic: Tan ghrain gholl siragh gys yn shere

Manx: As dooys ta’n seihll gaase doo as keear
English: And for me the world grows black and dark.
Diplomatic: As dooys t’an seihll gaase ghoo as keer

Manx: Ny-yeih ta’n sourey aalin çheh,
English: Yet the beautiful, hot summer,
Diplomatic: Ny-yeih tan sourey aalin chea

Manx: Lane gerjagh dou dy chooilley hraa,
English: Is always very comforting for me,
Diplomatic: Lane gerjagh dou dy chooilley chra

Manx: Yn ghrain ta soilshean heose syn aer,
English: The sun that shines up in the sky,
Diplomatic: Yn ghrain ta soljean heose syn aer

Manx: As druigh ta ooragh yn faiyr.
English: And the dew that freshens the grass.
Diplomatic: As druigh ta ooaragh yn faiyr

Manx: Dagh nhee ta’n crooder mooar er chroo,
English: Every thing the great creator has created,
Diplomatic: Dagh nhee tan crooder mooar er chroo

Manx: As cummal seose lesh bree e ghoo,
English: And sustained with the force of his word,
Diplomatic: As commal seose lesh bree y ghoo

Manx: As ushagyn ta lane dy chiaull,
English: And birds that are full of music,
Diplomatic: As ushagyn ta lane dy chiaull

Manx: Ta jannoo taitnyssagh dagh boayl.
English: That makes every place enjoyable.
Diplomatic: Ta jannoo taitnyssagh dagh boall

Manx: O Yee, cur dooys yn Spyrryd Noo,
English: O God, give me the Holy Spirit,
Diplomatic: O Yee cur dooys yn Spyrryd Noo

Manx: Dy niartagh my hreisht ayns dty ghoo,
English: To fortify my trust in your word,
Diplomatic: Dy nhiartagh my chreest ayns dy ghoo

Manx: Dy hoieagh m’aigney slane ort hene,
English: To set my mind fully on you,
Diplomatic: Dy hoieagh m’aigney slane ort hene

Manx: As grayse dy chosney maynrys beayn.
English: And grace to earn lasting happiness.
Diplomatic: As grays dy chostney maynrys beayn

Manx: Dy voddym lhie ec bun dty crosh,
English: That I may lie at the foot of your cross
Diplomatic: Dy voddym lhie eck bun t crosh

Manx: Choud’s t’ou spaarail mee ayns shoh wass,
English: Whilst you spare me in this world,
Diplomatic: Chouds tou spaarail mee ayns shoh wass

Manx: Son bee my vea dy leah ec kione,
English: For my life will be soon at an end,
Diplomatic: Son bee my vea dy lheay eck kione

Manx: Myr Adam mârish ooilley e chloan.
English: Like Adam with all his children.
Diplomatic: Myr Addam maarish ooilley y cloan

Manx: Hiarn, cur dou grayse hooyd hene dy phrayal,
English: Lord, give me grace to pray to you,
Diplomatic: Hiarn chur dou grayse hooyd hene dy preeal

Manx: As ayns fuill gheyr dty Vac treishteil,
English: Trusting In the dear blood of your Son,
Diplomatic: As ayns fuill deyr dy Vac treishteele

Manx: Ren roie son ain er Calvary,
English: That bled for us on Calvary,
Diplomatic: Ren roie son ain er calvary

Manx: Dy chordail peccee reesht rish Jee.
English: To reconcile sinners with God.
Diplomatic: Dy cordaill peccee reesht rish Jee

Manx: O, Niee my annym ayns yn uill,
English: O, Wash my soul in the blood,
Diplomatic: O nhiee my annym ayns yn uill

Manx: Ta glenney peccee voish dagh foill,
English: That purifies sinners from every fault,
Diplomatic: Ta glenney peccee voish dagh fooil

Manx: Gys nee dy vighyn fakin mie,
English: Until your mercy sees good,
Diplomatic: Gys nee dy vighyn fakin mie

Manx: Dy eamagh er my annym thie.
English: To call my soul home.
Diplomatic: Dy eamagh er my annym thie

Manx: Veih seihll dy voirey as anvea,
English: From a world of trouble and dischord,
Diplomatic: Veih seihll dy voirey as anvea

Manx: Dy akin Chreest ayns Niau, myr te,
English: To see Christ in Heaven, as he is,
Diplomatic: Dy akin Chreest ayns Niau myr te

Manx: O cum mee seose lesh dty laue yesh,
English: O, hold me up with your right hand,
Diplomatic: O cum mee seose lesh dy laue yesh

Manx: Gys beem gys maynrys currit lesh.
English: Until I will brought to happiness.
Diplomatic: Gys beem gys maynrys curryt lesh

Manx: E Faragher
English: E Faragher
Diplomatic: E Faragher
